title: What is Vue.js?

metadata.description: Learn about What is Vue.js? with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Vue.js lets you extend HTML with HTML attributes called directives Vue.js directives offers functionality to HTML applications Vue.js provides built-in directives and user defined directives For a full Vue.js tutorial: Go to our Vue.js Tutorial ❯ Vue.js Directives Vue.js uses double braces {{ }} as place-holders for data. Vue.js directives are HTML attributes with the prefix v- Vue Example In the example below, a new Vue object is created with new Vue() . The property el: binds the new Vue object to the HTML element with id="app" . Example

{{ message }}

Vue.js Binding When a Vue object is bound to an HTML element, the HTML element will change when the Vue object changes: Example
{{ message }}
Vue.js Two-Way Binding The v-model directive binds the value of HTML elements to application data. This is called two-way binding: Example

{{ message }}

Vue.js Loop Binding Using the v-for directive to bind an array of Vue objects to an "array" of HTML element: Example

summary: This tutorial covers What is Vue.js? concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use What is Vue.js? effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of What is Vue.js? and how to apply it in your projects.
